00085 template <typename PointDataGridT>
00086 void loadPoints(PointDataGridT& grid)
00087 {
00088 #ifndef OPENVDB_2_ABI_COMPATIBLE
00089     grid.constTree().readNonresidentBuffers();
00090 #endif
00091 }
00092 
00093 
00094 template <typename PointDataGridT, typename MaskGridT>
00095 void loadPoints(PointDataGridT& grid, const MaskGridT& mask)
00096 {
00097     typedef typename PointDataGridT::TreeType PointDataTreeT;
00098 
00099     tree::ValueAccessor<const PointDataTreeT> pointsAcc(grid.constTree());
00100 
00101     typename MaskGridT::TreeType::LeafCIter leafIter = mask.constTree().cbeginLeaf();
00102 
00103     for (; leafIter; ++leafIter) {
00104         const Coord& ijk = leafIter->origin();
00105         const typename PointDataTreeT::LeafNodeType* leaf = pointsAcc.probeConstLeaf(ijk);
00106 
00107         if (!leaf)  continue;
00108 
00109         // load out of core leaf nodes
00110         if (leaf->buffer().isOutOfCore())    leaf->buffer().data();
00111     }
00112 }
00113 
00114 
00115 template <typename PointDataGridT>
00116 void loadPoints(PointDataGridT& grid, const BBoxd& bbox)
00117 {
00118     typedef typename PointDataGridT::template ValueConverter<bool>::Type BoolGridT;
00119 
00120     // Transform the world-space bounding box into the source grid's index space.
00121     Vec3d idxMin, idxMax;
00122     math::calculateBounds(grid.constTransform(), bbox.min(), bbox.max(), idxMin, idxMax);
00123     CoordBBox region(Coord::floor(idxMin), Coord::floor(idxMax));
00124 
00125     // Construct a boolean mask grid that is true inside the index-space bounding box
00126     // and false everywhere else.
00127     BoolGridT clipMask(/*background=*/false);
00128     clipMask.fill(region, /*value=*/true, /*active=*/true);
00129 
00130     // MaskGrid introduced in OpenVDB 3.2
00131     typedef BoolGrid MaskType;
00132 
00133     // Convert the input grid to a mask grid (with the same tree configuration).
00134     MaskType::Ptr pointsMask = MaskType::create(/*background=*/false);
00135     pointsMask->topologyUnion(grid);
00136     pointsMask->topologyIntersection(clipMask);
00137 
00138     loadPoints(grid, *pointsMask);
00139 }
